results.definition: the act of giving hope or support to someone

examples: boost the voltage in an electrical circuit

results.definition: contribute to the progress or growth of
give a boost to; be beneficial to
examples: The tax cut will boost the economy

results.definition: push or shove upward, as if from below or behind
examples: The singer had to be boosted onto the stage by a special contraption

results.definition: the act of giving a push
examples: he gave her a boost over the fence
